skill.name: pci-compliance
skill.description: Implement PCI DSS compliance requirements for secure handling of payment card data and payment systems. Use when securing payment processing, achieving PCI compliance, or implementing payment card security measures.
skill.summary: Implement PCI DSS compliance requirements for secure handling of payment card data and payment syste...

security_audit.summary: The skill contains only documentation and illustrative code snippets. No file access, network calls, or executable scripts were found.

content.user_title: Implement PCI compliance for card data
content.value_statement: Payment systems are risky when card data is handled incorrectly. This skill gives clear PCI DSS requirements and practical safeguards for secure processing.
actual_capabilities: Summarizes the 12 PCI DSS core requirements and compliance levels
Lists prohibited and allowed card data storage with masking example
Provides tokenization workflow guidance with Stripe token usage example
Shows encryption at rest and TLS configuration examples
Outlines access control and audit logging patterns
Provides a PCI compliance checklist and scope reduction tips
limitations: Does not provide legal certification or official PCI assessment results
Does not run automated scans or validate real systems
Does not integrate with payment processors on your behalf
Examples may need updates for future PCI DSS revisions

use_cases.title: Plan PCI scope early
use_cases.description: Identify which systems touch card data and reduce scope with hosted payments or tokens.

use_cases.title: Build controls checklist
use_cases.description: Map PCI requirements to access control, logging, and encryption tasks for audits.

use_cases.title: Design secure payment flow
use_cases.description: Use tokenization and masking guidance to avoid storing sensitive card data.

prompt_templates.title: PCI basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the 12 PCI DSS requirements and which ones apply to a hosted checkout flow.

prompt_templates.title: Data storage rules
prompt_templates.prompt: List which card data elements are prohibited and which can be stored, with masking guidance.

prompt_templates.title: Tokenization plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe a server side flow that uses payment tokens and avoids handling card numbers.

prompt_templates.title: Audit prep
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PCI readiness checklist for access control, logging, encryption, and testing.

output_examples.input: Give me a checklist for PCI DSS readiness for a small ecommerce site
output: Use hosted checkout or tokenization to avoid storing card data
Encrypt any stored PAN and mask display outputs
Restrict access to card data by role and log all access
Enforce TLS 1.2 or higher for all payment traffic
Run vulnerability scans and maintain patching process

best_practices: Minimize card data exposure by using hosted payments or tokens
Encrypt PAN at rest and enforce TLS for all transmissions
Log and review access to cardholder data regularly
anti_patterns: Storing CVV, track data, or PIN under any circumstances
Sending raw card details to backend services
Using default passwords on payment system components

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it is a text based skill and works on Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples but does not certify compliance or scan systems.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Stripe or other processors?
faq.answer: It describes tokenization flows but does not perform integrations or API calls.

faq.question: Does it collect or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it contains documentation only and has no data collection logic.

faq.question: What if I see conflicting PCI DSS guidance?
faq.answer: Follow official PCI DSS documents and your assessor guidance for final decisions.

faq.question: How does this compare to a compliance audit tool?
faq.answer: This is educational guidance, while audit tools test real systems and produce evidence.
